analyzed: paṭisambhidā magga
translated: The Path of Discrimination🔽The Pair

analyzed: yuga naddha vagga  suñña kathā
translated: The Empty Discourse

analyzed: evam me suta
translated: Thus have I heard.

original: ekaṁ samayaṁ bhagavā sāvatthiyaṁ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
analyzed: ekam samayam bhagavā sāvatthiyam viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme
translated: On one occasion the Blessed One was dwelling at Savatthi in Jeta’s Grove, Anathapindika’s Park.

original: Atha kho āyasmā ānando yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṁ abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ nisīdi.
analyzed: atha khalu āyasmai ānandaḥ yena bhagavā tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantam abhivādetvā ekamantam nisīdi
translated: Then the venerable Ananda approached the Blessed One, paid homage to him, sat down to one side,

original: Ekamantaṁ nisinno kho āyasmā ānando bhagavantaṁ etadavoca—
analyzed: eka mantam nisinnaḥ khalu āyasmai ānandaḥ bhagavantam etat avoca
translated: and said to him:

analyzed: suññaḥ loko suññaḥ loko ti bhante vuccati
translated: “Venerable sir, it is said, ‘Empty is the world, empty is the world.’

original: Kittāvatā nu kho, bhante, ‘suñño loko’ti vuccatī”ti?
analyzed: kittāvatā nu kho bhante suññaḥ loko ti vuccati iti
translated: In what way, venerable sir, is it said, ‘Empty is the world’?”

original: “Yasmā kho, ānanda, suññaṁ attena vā attaniyena vā, tasmā ‘suñño loko’ti vuccati.
analyzed: yasmā kho ānanda suññam attena vā attaniyena vā tasmā suññaḥ loko ti vuccati
translated: “Because it is empty, Ananda, of self and of what belongs to self, it is said, ‘Empty is the world.’

original: Kiñcānanda, suññaṁ attena vā attaniyena vā?
analyzed: kiñca ānanda suññam attena vā attaniyena vā
translated: And what, Ananda, is empty of self and of what belongs to self?

original: Cakkhu kho, ānanda, suññaṁ attena vā attaniyena vā.🔽Rūpā suññā attena vā attaniyena vā.
analyzed: cakkhu kho ānanda suññam attena vā attaniyena vā  rūpā suññā attena vā attaniyena vā
translated: The eye, Ananda, is empty of self and of what belongs to self.🔽Forms are empty of self and of what belongs to self.

original: Cakkhuviññāṇaṁ suññaṁ attena vā attaniyena vā.
analyzed: cakkhu viññāṇam suññam attena vā attaniyena vā
translated: Eye-consciousness is empty of self and of what belongs to self.

original: Cakkhusamphasso suñño attena vā attaniyena vā.
analyzed: cakkhu samphasso suññaḥ attena vā attaniyena vā
translated: Eye contact is empty of self and of what belongs to self.

original: Yampidaṁ cakkhusamphassapaccayā uppajjati vedayitaṁ sukhaṁ vā dukkhaṁ vā adukkhamasukhaṁ vā, tampi suññaṁ attena vā attaniyena vā.🔽Sotaṁ suññaṁ …pe…🔽saddā suññā …
analyzed: yat pi idam cakkhu samphassa paccayā uppajjati vedayitam sukham vā dukkham vā adukkham asukham vā tam pi suññam attena vā attaniyena vā  sotam suññam pe  saddā suññā
translated: The pleasant, painful, or neither-painful-nor-pleasant feeling that arises conditioned by eye contact is also empty of self and of what belongs to self.🔽The ear is empty …🔽Sounds are empty …

analyzed: ghānam suññam  gandhā suññā  jivhā suññā
translated: The nose is empty …🔽Smells are empty …🔽The tongue is empty …

analyzed: rasā suññā
translated: Flavors are empty …

analyzed: kāyaḥ suññaḥ
translated: The body is empty …

original: phoṭṭhabbā suññā …🔽mano suñño attena vā attaniyena vā.🔽Dhammā suññā attena vā attaniyena vā.
analyzed: phoṭṭhabbā suññā  manaḥ suññaḥ attena vā attaniyena vā  dhammā suññā attena vā attaniyena vā
translated: Tangibles are empty …🔽The mind is empty of self and of what belongs to self.🔽Thoughts are empty of self and of what belongs to self.

original: Manoviññāṇaṁ suññaṁ attena vā attaniyena vā.
analyzed: manaḥ viññāṇam suññam attena vā attaniyena vā
translated: Mind-consciousness is empty of self and of what belongs to self.

original: Manosamphasso suñño attena vā attaniyena vā.
analyzed: manaḥ samphassaḥ suññaḥ attena vā attaniyena vā
translated: Mind contact is empty of self and of what belongs to self.

original: Yampidaṁ manosamphassapaccayā uppajjati vedayitaṁ sukhaṁ vā dukkhaṁ vā adukkhamasukhaṁ vā, tampi suññaṁ attena vā attaniyena vā.
analyzed: yat pi idam manaḥ samphassa paccayā uppajjati vedayitam sukham vā dukkham vā adukkham asukham vā tam pi suññam attena vā attaniyena vā
translated: The pleasant, painful, or neither-painful-nor-pleasant feeling that arises conditioned by mind contact is also empty of self and of what belongs to self.

original: Yasmā kho, ānanda, suññaṁ attena vā attaniyena vā tasmā ‘suñño loko’ti vuccatī”ti.
analyzed: yasmā kho ānanda suññam attena vā attaniyena vā tasmā suññaḥ loko ti vuccati iti
translated: Since it is empty of self and of what belongs to self, therefore it is said, ‘The world is empty.’”

analyzed: mātikā
translated: The Numerical Lists

original: Suññasuññaṁ, saṅkhārasuññaṁ, vipariṇāmasuññaṁ, aggasuññaṁ, lakkhaṇasuññaṁ, vikkhambhanasuññaṁ,
analyzed: suñña suñña saṅkhāra suñña vipariṇāma suñña agga suñña lakkhaṇa suñña vikkhambhana suñña
translated: void of void, void of formations, void of change, void of the highest, void of characteristics, void of suppression,

original: tadaṅgasuññaṁ, samucchedasuññaṁ, paṭippassaddhisuññaṁ, nissaraṇasuññaṁ, ajjhattasuññaṁ,🔽bahiddhāsuññaṁ, dubhatosuññaṁ, sabhāgasuññaṁ, visabhāgasuññaṁ, esanāsuññaṁ, pariggahasuññaṁ,🔽paṭilābhasuññaṁ, paṭivedhasuññaṁ, ekattasuññaṁ, nānattasuññaṁ, khantisuññaṁ, adhiṭṭhānasuññaṁ,
analyzed: tad aṅga suñña samuccheda suñña paṭippassaddhi suñña nissaraṇa suñña ajjhatta suñña  bahiddhāsuñña dubhatosuñña sabhāga suñña visabhāga suñña esanā suñña pariggaha suñña  paṭilābha suñña paṭivedha suñña ekatta suñña nānatta suñña khanti suñña adhiṭṭhāna suñña
translated: The emptiness of what is void, the emptiness of conditioned phenomena, the emptiness of ultimate reality, the emptiness of the highest, the emptiness of characteristics, the emptiness of abandonment,🔽the emptiness of what is not to be discarded, the emptiness of cessation, the emptiness of escape, the emptiness of the internal,🔽the emptiness of the external, the emptiness of both, the emptiness of what is similar, the emptiness of what is dissimilar, the emptiness of searching, the emptiness of grasping,🔽the emptiness of attainment, the emptiness of penetration, the emptiness of unity, the emptiness of diversity, the emptiness of acceptance, the emptiness of determination,

analyzed: sampajānassa pavatta pariyādānam sabba suñña tānam paramattha suñña
translated: the emptiness of appropriation, the exhaustion of the occurrence of one who is fully aware, the ultimate emptiness of all kinds of emptiness.

analyzed: niddesa
translated: .. The Explanation

analyzed: katamam
translated: What is the emptiness of what is void?

original: Cakkhu suññaṁ attena vā attaniyena vā niccena vā dhuvena vā sassatena vā avipariṇāmadhammena vā.🔽Sotaṁ suññaṁ …pe…🔽ghānaṁ suññaṁ …
analyzed: cakkhu suññam attena vā attaniyena vā niccena vā dhuvena vā sassatena vā a vipariṇāma dhammena vā  sotam suññam pe  ghānam suññam
translated: The eye is void of self or anything pertaining to self, of permanence, of lastingness, of eternalness, or of non-subject-to-alteration.🔽The ear is void …🔽The nose is void …

analyzed: jivhā suññā
translated: The tongue is void …

analyzed: kāyaḥ suññaḥ
translated: The body is void …

original: mano suñño attena vā attaniyena vā niccena vā dhuvena vā sassatena vā avipariṇāmadhammena vā.
analyzed: mano suññaḥ attena vā attaniyena vā niccena vā dhuvena vā sassatena vā a vipariṇāma dhammena vā
translated: The mind is empty of a self or what belongs to a self, of being permanent, everlasting, eternal, not subject to change, or of being the self.

analyzed: idam suñña suñña
translated: This is the emptiness of emptiness.

analyzed: katamam
translated: What is the emptiness of conditions?

analyzed: tayoḥ saṅkhārā
translated: There are three kinds of conditions:

original: puññābhisaṅkhāro, apuññābhisaṅkhāro, āneñjābhisaṅkhāro.🔽Puññābhisaṅkhāro apuññābhisaṅkhārena ca āneñjābhisaṅkhārena ca suñño.🔽Apuññābhisaṅkhāro puññābhisaṅkhārena ca āneñjābhisaṅkhārena ca suñño.
analyzed: puñña abhisaṅkhāraḥ apuñña abhisaṅkhāraḥ āneñja abhisaṅkhāraḥ  puñña abhisaṅkhāraḥ apuñña abhisaṅkhārena ca āneñja abhisaṅkhārena ca suññaḥ  apuñña abhisaṅkhāro puñña abhisaṅkhārena ca āneñja abhisaṅkhārena ca suññaḥ
translated: meritorious conditions, demeritorious conditions, and imperturbable conditions.🔽Meritorious conditions are empty of demeritorious and imperturbable conditions.🔽Demeritorious conditions are empty of meritorious and imperturbable conditions.

original: Āneñjābhisaṅkhāro puññābhisaṅkhārena ca apuññābhisaṅkhārena ca suñño.
analyzed: āneñja abhisaṅkhāro puñña abhisaṅkhārena ca apuñña abhisaṅkhārena ca suññaḥ
translated: Imperturbable conditions are empty of meritorious and demeritorious conditions.

analyzed: ime tayo saṅkhārā
translated: These are the three kinds of conditions.

analyzed: apare pi tayo saṅkhārā
translated: There are three other kinds of conditions:

original: kāyasaṅkhāro, vacīsaṅkhāro, cittasaṅkhāro.🔽Kāyasaṅkhāro vacīsaṅkhārena ca cittasaṅkhārena ca suñño.🔽Vacīsaṅkhāro kāyasaṅkhārena ca cittasaṅkhārena ca suñño.
analyzed: kāya saṅkhāraḥ vacī saṅkhāraḥ citta saṅkhāraḥ  kāya saṅkhāraḥ vacī saṅkhārena ca citta saṅkhārena ca suññaḥ  vacī saṅkhāro kāya saṅkhārena ca citta saṅkhārena ca suññaḥ
translated: bodily conditions, verbal conditions, and mental conditions.🔽Bodily conditions are empty of verbal and mental conditions.🔽Verbal conditions are empty of bodily and mental conditions.

original: Cittasaṅkhāro kāyasaṅkhārena ca vacīsaṅkhārena ca suñño.
analyzed: citta saṅkhāro kāya saṅkhārena ca vacī saṅkhārena ca suññaḥ
translated: Mental conditions are empty of bodily and verbal conditions.

analyzed: ime tayo saṅkhārā
translated: These are the three kinds of conditions.

analyzed: apare pi tayo saṅkhārā
translated: There are also three kinds of determinations:

original: atītā saṅkhārā, anāgatā saṅkhārā, paccuppannā saṅkhārā.
analyzed: atītā saṅkhārā anāgatā saṅkhārā paccuppannā saṅkhārā
translated: past determinations, future determinations, and present determinations.

original: Atītā saṅkhārā anāgatehi ca paccuppannehi ca saṅkhārehi suññā.
analyzed: atītā saṅkhārā anāgatehi ca paccuppannehi ca saṅkhārehi suññā
translated: Past determinations are void of future and present determinations.

original: Anāgatā saṅkhārā atītehi ca paccuppannehi ca saṅkhārehi suññā paccuppannā saṅkhārā atītehi ca anāgatehi ca saṅkhārehi suññā.🔽Ime tayo saṅkhārā;
analyzed: anāgatā saṅkhārā atītehi ca paccuppannehi ca saṅkhārehi suññā paccuppannā saṅkhārā atītehi ca anāgatehi ca saṅkhārehi suññā  ime tayo saṅkhārā
translated: Future determinations are void of past and present determinations. Present determinations are void of past and future determinations.

analyzed: idam
translated: These are the three kinds of determinations.🔽This is the voidness of determinations.

analyzed: katamam vipariṇāma suñña
translated: What is the voidness of alteration?

analyzed: jātam rūpam sabhāvena
translated: Arisen form is void of its own inherent nature.

analyzed: vigatam rūpam vipariṇatam ca iva suññam ca
translated: Form that has disappeared has altered and is void.

analyzed: jātā vedanā sabhāvena suññā
translated: Arisen feeling is void of its own inherent nature.

original: Vigatā vedanā vipariṇatā ceva suññā ca …pe…
analyzed: vigatā vedanā vipariṇatā ca iva suññā ca pe
translated: Feeling that has disappeared has altered and is void. …

analyzed: jātā saññā
translated: Arisen perception …

analyzed: jātā saṅkhārā
translated: Arisen determinations …

analyzed: jātam viññāṇam
translated: Arisen consciousness …

analyzed: jātam cakkhu pe
translated: Arisen eye …

analyzed: jātaḥ bhavaḥ sabhāvena suññaḥ
translated: Arisen being is void of its own inherent nature.

original: Vigato bhavo vipariṇato ceva suñño ca.
analyzed: vigataḥ bhavaḥ vipariṇato ca iva suñño ca
translated: Being that has disappeared has altered and is void.

analyzed: idam
translated: This is the voidness of alteration.

analyzed: katamaṃ aggasuñña
translated: What is the voidness of the highest?

original: Aggametaṁ padaṁ seṭṭhametaṁ padaṁ visiṭṭhametaṁ padaṁ yadidaṁ sabbasaṅkhārasamatho sabbūpadhipaṭinissaggo taṇhakkhayo virāgo nirodho nibbānaṁ.
analyzed: aggam etam padam seṭṭham etam padam visiṭṭham etam padam yat idam sabba saṅkhāra samatho sabba upadhi paṭinissaggo taṇhā khayaḥ virāgaḥ nirodhaḥ nibbāna
translated: The foremost, the highest, the best, the supreme, the most excellent of all is the stilling of all formations, the relinquishing of all attachments, the destruction of craving, dispassion, cessation, Nibbāna.

analyzed: idam aggasuñña
translated: This is the foremost emptiness.

analyzed: katamam
translated: What is emptiness of characteristics?

analyzed: dve lakkhaṇāni
translated: There are two characteristics:

analyzed: bāla lakkhaṇañca paṇḍita lakkhaṇañca  bāla lakkhaṇam paṇḍita lakkhaṇena
translated: the characteristic of the foolish and the characteristic of the wise.🔽The characteristic of the foolish is empty of the characteristic of the wise.

analyzed: paṇḍita lakkhaṇam bāla lakkhaṇena
translated: The characteristic of the wise is empty of the characteristic of the foolish.

original: Tīṇi lakkhaṇāni—🔽uppādalakkhaṇaṁ, vayalakkhaṇaṁ, ṭhitaññathattalakkhaṇaṁ.🔽Uppādalakkhaṇaṁ vayalakkhaṇena ca ṭhitaññathattalakkhaṇena ca suññaṁ.
analyzed: tīṇi lakkhaṇāni  uppāda lakkhaṇa vaya lakkhaṇa ṭhita aññathatta lakkhaṇa  uppāda lakkhaṇam vaya lakkhaṇena ca ṭhita aññathatta lakkhaṇena ca suñña
translated: There are three characteristics:🔽the characteristic of arising, the characteristic of vanishing, and the characteristic of remaining as it is or changing.🔽The characteristic of arising is empty of the characteristic of vanishing and the characteristic of remaining as it is or changing.

original: Vayalakkhaṇaṁ uppādalakkhaṇena ca ṭhitaññathattalakkhaṇena ca suññaṁ, ṭhitaññathattalakkhaṇaṁ uppādalakkhaṇena ca vayalakkhaṇena ca suññaṁ.
analyzed: vaya lakkhaṇam uppāda lakkhaṇena ca ṭhita aññathatta lakkhaṇena ca suñña ṭhita aññathatta lakkhaṇam uppāda lakkhaṇena ca vaya lakkhaṇena ca suñña
translated: The characteristic of vanishing is empty of the characteristic of arising and the characteristic of remaining as it is or changing. The characteristic of remaining as it is or changing is empty of the characteristic of arising and the characteristic of vanishing.

original: Rūpassa uppādalakkhaṇaṁ vayalakkhaṇena ca ṭhitaññathattalakkhaṇena ca suññaṁ.
analyzed: rūpassa uppāda lakkhaṇam vaya lakkhaṇena ca ṭhita aññathatta lakkhaṇena ca suñña
translated: The characteristic of arising of material form is empty of the characteristic of vanishing and the characteristic of remaining as it is or changing.

original: Rūpassa vayalakkhaṇaṁ uppādalakkhaṇena ca ṭhitaññathattalakkhaṇena ca suññaṁ.
analyzed: rūpassa vaya lakkhaṇam uppāda lakkhaṇena ca ṭhita aññathatta lakkhaṇena ca suñña
translated: The characteristic of the ageing of materiality is void of the characteristic of arising and of the characteristic of continuance-and-change.

original: Rūpassa ṭhitaññathattalakkhaṇaṁ uppādalakkhaṇena ca vayalakkhaṇena ca suññaṁ.🔽Vedanāya …pe…
analyzed: rūpassa ṭhita aññathatta lakkhaṇam uppāda lakkhaṇena ca vaya lakkhaṇena ca suñña  vedanāya pe
translated: The characteristic of continuance-and-change of materiality is void of the characteristic of arising and of the characteristic of ageing.🔽With regard to feeling …

analyzed: saññāya  saṅkhārānam
translated: With regard to perception …🔽With regard to the mental formations …

analyzed: viññāṇassa
translated: With regard to consciousness …

analyzed: cakkhussa
translated: With regard to the eye …

original: jarāmaraṇassa uppādalakkhaṇaṁ vayalakkhaṇena ca ṭhitaññathattalakkhaṇena ca suññaṁ.🔽Jarāmaraṇassa vayalakkhaṇaṁ uppādalakkhaṇena ca ṭhitaññathattalakkhaṇena ca suññaṁ.
analyzed: jarā maraṇassa uppāda lakkhaṇam vaya lakkhaṇena ca ṭhita aññathatta lakkhaṇena ca suñña  jarā maraṇassa vaya lakkhaṇam uppāda lakkhaṇena ca ṭhita aññathatta lakkhaṇena ca suññata
translated: The characteristic of arising of ageing-and-death is void of the characteristic of ageing and of the characteristic of continuance-and-change.🔽The characteristic of ageing of ageing-and-death is void of the characteristic of arising and of the characteristic of continuance-and-change.

original: Jarāmaraṇassa ṭhitaññathattalakkhaṇaṁ uppādalakkhaṇena ca vayalakkhaṇena ca suññaṁ.
analyzed: jarā maraṇassa ṭhita aññathatta lakkhaṇam uppāda lakkhaṇena ca vaya lakkhaṇena ca suñña
translated: The characteristic of continuance-and-change of ageing-and-death is void of the characteristic of arising and of the characteristic of ageing.

analyzed: idam lakkhaṇa suñña
translated: This is voidness of characteristics.

analyzed: katamam
translated: What is voidness of suppression?

original: Nekkhammena kāmacchando vikkhambhito ceva suñño ca.🔽Abyāpādena byāpādo vikkhambhito ceva suñño ca.
analyzed: nekkhammena kāmacchandaḥ vikkhambhito ca iva suññaḥ ca  a byāpādena byāpādaḥ vikkhambhito ca iva suññaḥ ca
translated: Sensual desire is suppressed and void by non-greed.🔽Ill will is suppressed and void by non-ill will.

analyzed: āloka saññāya thinam iddham vikkhambhitañca ca iva suññam ca
translated: Dullness and drowsiness are suppressed and void by the perception of light.

original: Avikkhepena uddhaccaṁ vikkhambhitañceva suññañca.🔽Dhammavavatthānena vicikicchā vikkhambhitā ceva suññā ca.
analyzed: avikkhepena uddhaccam vikkhambhitañca ca iva suññañca  dhamma vavatthānena vicikicchā vikkhambhitā ca iva suññā ca
translated: With non-distraction, agitation is both suppressed and void.🔽With definition of ideas, uncertainty is both suppressed and void.

original: Ñāṇena avijjā vikkhambhitā ceva suññā ca.🔽Pāmojjena arati vikkhambhitā ceva suññā ca.
analyzed: ñāṇena avijjā vikkhambhitā ca iva suññā ca  pāmojjena arati vikkhambhitā ca iva suññā ca
translated: With knowledge, ignorance is both suppressed and void.🔽With gladness, grief is both suppressed and void.

original: Paṭhamena jhānena nīvaraṇā vikkhambhitā ceva suññā ca …pe…
analyzed: paṭhamena jhānena nīvaraṇā vikkhambhitā ca iva suññā ca pe
translated: With the first jhana, the hindrances are both suppressed and void.

original: arahattamaggena sabbakilesā vikkhambhitā ceva suññā ca.
analyzed: arahatta maggena sabba kilesā vikkhambhitā ca iva suññā ca
translated: With the path of arahatship, all defilements are both suppressed and void.

analyzed: idam vikkhambhana suñña
translated: This is voidness of suppression.

analyzed: katamam
translated: What is voidness of a component?

analyzed: nekkhammena kāmacchandaḥ tad aṅga suññaḥ
translated: With renunciation, lust is void of a component.

original: Abyāpādena byāpādo tadaṅgasuñño.🔽Ālokasaññāya thinamiddhaṁ tadaṅgasuññaṁ.🔽Avikkhepena uddhaccaṁ tadaṅgasuññaṁ.
analyzed: a byāpādena byāpādaḥ tad aṅga suñño  āloka saññāya thinam iddham  avikkhepena uddhaccam
translated: With non-ill will, ill will is void of a component.🔽With perception of light, stiffness-and-torpor is void of a component.🔽With non-distraction, agitation is void of a component.

analyzed: dhamma vavatthānena vicikicchā tad aṅga suññā
translated: With definition of ideas, uncertainty is void of a component.

analyzed: ñāṇena avijjā tad aṅga suññā
translated: With knowledge, ignorance is void of a component.

analyzed: pāmojjena tad aṅga suññā
translated: With gladness, grief is void of a component.🔽With the first jhana, the hindrances are void of a component.

analyzed: paṭhamena jhānena nīvaraṇā tad aṅga suññā pe
translated: The hindrances are void of the first jhāna and its factors …

analyzed: vivaṭṭana anupassanāya saññoga abhiniveso tad aṅga suññaḥ
translated: The perception of relinking is empty of being a condition and of being a condition’s property.

analyzed: idam tad aṅga suñña
translated: This is emptiness of what is not there.

original: Katamaṁ samucchedasuññaṁ?🔽Nekkhammena kāmacchando samucchinno ceva suñño ca.
analyzed: katamam  nekkhammena kāmacchando samucchinno ca iva suñño ca
translated: What is emptiness of what is essentially nonexistent?🔽Sensual desire is cut off and empty of sensual desire.

original: Abyāpādena byāpādo samucchinno ceva suñño ca.🔽Ālokasaññāya thinamiddhaṁ samucchinnañceva suññañca.🔽Avikkhepena uddhaccaṁ samucchinnañceva suññañca.
analyzed: a byāpādena byāpādaḥ samucchinno ca iva suñño ca  āloka saññāya thinam iddham samucchinnam ca iva suññam ca  avikkhepena uddhaccam samucchinnañca iva suññañca
translated: Ill will is cut off and empty of ill will.🔽Sloth and torpor are cut off and empty of sloth and torpor.🔽Restlessness and remorse are cut off and empty of restlessness and remorse.

original: Dhammavavatthānena vicikicchā samucchinnā ceva suññā ca.🔽Ñāṇena avijjā samucchinnā ceva suññā ca.
analyzed: dhamma vavatthānena vicikicchā samucchinnā ca iva suññā ca  ñāṇena avijjā samucchinnā ca iva suññā ca
translated: Doubt is cut off and empty of doubt.🔽Ignorance is cut off and empty of ignorance.

original: Pāmojjena arati samucchinnā ceva suññā ca.
analyzed: pāmojjena arati samucchinnā ca iva suññā ca
translated: Boredom is cut off and empty of boredom.

original: Paṭhamena jhānena nīvaraṇā samucchinnā ceva suññā ca …pe…
analyzed: paṭhamena jhānena nīvaraṇā samucchinnā ca iva suññā ca pe
translated: The hindrances are cut off and empty of the hindrances. …

original: arahattamaggena sabbakilesā samucchinnā ceva suññā ca.
analyzed: arahatta maggena sabba kilesā samucchinnā ca iva suññā ca
translated: All defilements are cut off and empty of all defilements.

analyzed: idam
translated: This is emptiness of what is essentially nonexistent.

analyzed: katamam
translated: What is emptiness of specific characteristics?

original: Nekkhammena kāmacchando paṭippassaddho ceva suñño ca.
analyzed: nekkhammena kāmacchando paṭippassaddho ca iva suññaḥ ca
translated: Sensual desire is stilled and empty of sensual desire.

original: Abyāpādena byāpādo paṭippassaddho ceva suñño ca.
analyzed: a byāpādena byāpādaḥ paṭippassaddho ca iva suññaḥ ca
translated: Ill will is stilled and void.

analyzed: āloka saññāya thinam iddham paṭippassaddham ca iva suññam ca
translated: Drowsiness and torpor are stilled and void.🔽Agitation is stilled and void.

original: Avikkhepena uddhaccaṁ paṭippassaddhañceva suññañca.🔽Dhammavavatthānena vicikicchā paṭippassaddhā ceva suññā ca.🔽Ñāṇena avijjā paṭippassaddhā ceva suññā ca.
analyzed: avikkhepena uddhaccam paṭippassaddham ca iva suññam ca  dhamma vavatthānena vicikicchā paṭippassaddhā ca iva suññā ca  ñāṇena avijjā paṭippassaddhā ca iva suññā ca
translated: Uncertainty is stilled and void.🔽Ignorance is stilled and void.

original: Pāmojjena arati paṭippassaddhā ceva suññā ca.🔽Paṭhamena jhānena nīvaraṇā paṭippassaddhā ceva suññā ca …pe…
analyzed: pāmojjena arati paṭippassaddhā ca iva suññā ca  paṭhamena jhānena nīvaraṇā paṭippassaddhā ca iva suññā ca pe
translated: Boredom is stilled and void.🔽The hindrances are stilled and void.

original: arahattamaggena sabbakilesā paṭippassaddhā ceva suññā ca.
analyzed: arahatta maggena sabba kilesā paṭippassaddhā ca iva suññā ca
translated: All defilements are stilled and void.

analyzed: idam
translated: This is the voidness of stilling.

analyzed: katamam
translated: What is the voidness of escape?

original: Nekkhammena kāmacchando nissaṭo ceva suñño ca.🔽Abyāpādena byāpādo nissaṭo ceva suñño ca.
analyzed: nekkhammena kāmacchandaḥ nissaṭaḥ ca iva suñño ca  a byāpādena byāpādaḥ nissaṭaḥ ca iva suññaḥ ca
translated: Sensual desire is escaped from and void.🔽Ill will is escaped from and void.

analyzed: āloka saññāya thinam iddham nissaṭam ca iva suññam ca
translated: Drowsiness and torpor are escaped from and void.

analyzed: avikkhepena uddhaccam nissaṭam ca iva suññam ca
translated: Agitation is escaped from and void.

original: Dhammavavatthānena vicikicchā nissaṭā ceva suññā ca.🔽Ñāṇena avijjā nissaṭā ceva suññā ca.
analyzed: dhamma vavatthānena vicikicchā nissaṭā ca iva suññā ca  ñāṇena avijjā nissaṭā ca iva suññā ca
translated: With the defining of ideas, doubt is abandoned and is void.🔽With knowledge, ignorance is abandoned and is void.

original: Pāmojjena arati nissaṭā ceva suññā ca.
analyzed: pāmojjena arati nissaṭā ca iva suññā ca
translated: With gladness, discontent is abandoned and is void.

original: Paṭhamena jhānena nīvaraṇā nissaṭā ceva suññā ca …pe…
analyzed: paṭhamena jhānena nīvaraṇā nissaṭā ca iva suññā ca pe
translated: With the first jhana, the hindrances are abandoned and are void. …

original: arahattamaggena sabbakilesā nissaṭā ceva suññā ca.
analyzed: arahatta maggena sabba kilesā nissaṭā ca iva suññā ca
translated: With the path of arahatship, all defilements are abandoned and are void.

analyzed: idam
translated: This is voidness of escape.

analyzed: katamam
translated: What is voidness of the internal?

original: Ajjhattaṁ cakkhuṁ suññaṁ attena vā attaniyena vā niccena vā dhuvena vā sassatena vā avipariṇāmadhammena vā.🔽Ajjhattaṁ sotaṁ suññaṁ …🔽ajjhattaṁ ghānaṁ suññaṁ …
analyzed: ajjhattam cakkhum suññam attena vā attaniyena vā niccena vā dhuvena vā sassatena vā a vipariṇāma dhammena vā  ajjhattam sotam suññam  ajjhattam ghānam suññam
translated: The eye is void of self and of the property of a self, of permanence, of lastingness, of eternity, and of non-subjectness to change.🔽The ear is void …🔽The nose is void …

analyzed: ajjhattam jivhā suññā
translated: The tongue is void …

analyzed: ajjhattam kāyaḥ suññaḥ
translated: The body is void …

original: ajjhattaṁ mano suñño attena vā attaniyena vā niccena vā dhuvena vā sassatena vā avipariṇāmadhammena vā.
analyzed: ajjhattam manaḥ suññaḥ attena vā attaniyena vā niccena vā dhuvena vā sassatena vā a vipariṇāma dhammena vā
translated: The mind is void of self and of the property of a self, of permanence, of lastingness, of eternity, and of non-subjectness to change.

analyzed: idam ajjhatta suñña
translated: This is voidness of the internal.

analyzed: katamam
translated: What is voidness of the external?🔽External forms are void …

analyzed: bahiddhā rūpā suññā pe
translated: “External forms are void of self and of what belongs to a self.🔽

original: bahiddhā dhammā suññā attena vā attaniyena vā niccena vā dhuvena vā sassatena vā avipariṇāmadhammena vā.
analyzed: bahiddhā dhammā suññāḥ attena vā attaniyena vā niccena vā dhuvena vā sassatena vā a vipariṇāma dhammena vā
translated: External things are void of self or of what belongs to self, of permanence, of lastingness, of eternity, of non-subjectness to change.

analyzed: idam
translated: This is the voidness of the external.

original: Katamaṁ dubhatosuññaṁ?🔽Yañca ajjhattaṁ cakkhu ye ca bahiddhā rūpā ubhayametaṁ suññaṁ attena vā attaniyena vā niccena vā dhuvena vā sassatena vā avipariṇāmadhammena vā.🔽Yañca ajjhattaṁ sotaṁ ye ca bahiddhā saddā …pe…🔽yañca ajjhattaṁ ghānaṁ ye ca bahiddhā gandhā …🔽yā ca ajjhattaṁ jivhā ye ca bahiddhā rasā …🔽yo ca ajjhattaṁ kāyo ye ca bahiddhā phoṭṭhabbā …
analyzed: katamam  yat ca ajjhattam cakkhu ye ca bahiddhā rūpāḥ ubhayam etam suññam attena vā attaniyena vā niccena vā dhuvena vā sassatena vā a vipariṇāma dhammena vā  yat ca ajjhattam sotam ye ca bahiddhā saddāḥ pe  yat ca ajjhattam ghānam ye ca bahiddhā gandhāḥ  yā ca ajjhattam jivhā ye ca bahiddhā rasā  yaḥ ca ajjhattam kāyaḥ ye ca bahiddhā phoṭṭhabbā
translated: What is the voidness of the internal and the external?

original: yo ca ajjhattaṁ mano ye ca bahiddhā dhammā ubhayametaṁ suññaṁ attena vā attaniyena vā niccena vā dhuvena vā sassatena vā avipariṇāmadhammena vā.🔽Idaṁ dubhatosuññaṁ.
analyzed: yaḥ ca ajjhattam manaḥ ye ca bahiddhā dhammāḥ ubhayam etam suññam attena vā attaniyena vā niccena vā dhuvena vā sassatena vā a vipariṇāma dhammena vā  idam dubhatosuñña
translated: The eye and forms, the ear and sounds, the nose and smells, the tongue and tastes, the body and tactiles, the mind and thoughts are void of self or of what belongs to self, of permanence, of lastingness, of eternity, of non-subjectness to change.🔽This is the voidness of the internal and the external.

analyzed: katamam
translated: What is the voidness of what is possible?

original: Cha ajjhattikāni āyatanāni sabhāgāni ceva suññāni ca.
analyzed: cha ajjhattikāni āyatanāni sabhāgāni ca iva suññāni ca
translated: The six internal sense spheres are similar and void.

original: Cha bāhirāni āyatanāni sabhāgāni ceva suññāni ca.🔽Cha viññāṇakāyā sabhāgā ceva suññā ca.
analyzed: cha bāhirāni āyatanāni sabhāgāni ca iva suññāni ca  cha viññāṇa kāyā sabhāgā ca iva suññā ca
translated: The six external sense spheres are similar and void.🔽The six classes of consciousness are similar and void.

original: Cha phassakāyā sabhāgā ceva suññā ca.🔽Cha vedanākāyā sabhāgā ceva suññā ca.🔽Cha saññākāyā sabhāgā ceva suññā ca.
analyzed: cha phassa kāyā sabhāgā ca iva suññā ca  cha vedanā kāyā sabhāgā ca iva suññā ca  cha saññā kāyā sabhāgā ca iva suññā ca
translated: The six classes of contact are similar and void.🔽The six classes of feeling are similar and void.🔽The six classes of perception are similar and void.

original: Cha cetanākāyā sabhāgā ceva suññā ca.
analyzed: cha cetanā kāyā sabhāgā ca iva suññā ca
translated: The six classes of volition are similar and void.

analyzed: idam
translated: This is the voidness of the similar.

original: Katamaṁ visabhāgasuññaṁ?🔽Cha ajjhattikāni āyatanāni chahi bāhirehi āyatanehi visabhāgāni ceva suññāni ca.
analyzed: katamam  cha ajjhattikāni āyatanāni chahi bāhirehi āyatanehi visabhāgāni ca iva suññāni ca
translated: What is the voidness of the dissimilar?🔽The six internal sense spheres are dissimilar and void in relation to the six external sense spheres.

original: Cha bāhirāni āyatanāni chahi viññāṇakāyehi visabhāgāni ceva suññāni ca.
analyzed: cha bāhirāni āyatanāni chahi viññāṇakāyehi visabhāgāni ca iva suññāni ca
translated: The six external sense spheres are dissimilar and void in relation to the six classes of consciousness.

original: Cha viññāṇakāyā chahi phassakāyehi visabhāgā ceva suññā ca.🔽Cha phassakāyā chahi vedanākāyehi visabhāgā ceva suññā ca.
analyzed: cha viññāṇa kāyā chahi phassa kāyehi visabhāgā ca iva suññā ca  cha phassa kāyā chahi vedanā kāyehi visabhāgā ca iva suññā ca
translated: The six classes of consciousness are dissimilar and void in relation to the six classes of contact.🔽The six classes of contact are dissimilar and void in relation to the six classes of feeling.

original: Cha vedanākāyā chahi saññākāyehi visabhāgā ceva suññā ca.
analyzed: cha vedanā kāyā chahi saññā kāyehi visabhāgā ca iva suññā ca
translated: The six classes of feeling are dissimilar and void in relation to the six classes of perception.

original: Cha saññākāyā chahi cetanākāyehi visabhāgā ceva suññā ca.
analyzed: cha saññā kāyā chahi cetanā kāyehi visabhāgā ca iva suññā ca
translated: The six classes of perception are different and void of the six classes of intention.

analyzed: idam
translated: This is the voidness of what is different.

analyzed: katamam
translated: What is voidness of search?

analyzed: nekkhammesanā kāmacchandena suññā
translated: The search for renunciation is void of sensual desire.

analyzed: a byāpāda esanā byāpādena suññā
translated: The search for non-ill-will is void of ill-will.

analyzed: āloka saññesanā thinam iddhena suññā  avikkhepa īsanā uddhaccena suññā
translated: The search for the perception of light is void of stiffness and torpor.🔽The search for non-distraction is void of agitation.

analyzed: dhamma vavatthāna īsanā vicikicchāya suññā  ñāṇa īsanā avijjāya suññā
translated: The search for the determination of ideas is void of uncertainty.🔽The search for knowledge is void of ignorance.

analyzed: pāmojjesanā aratiyā suññā
translated: The search for gladness is void of discontent.

analyzed: paṭhamajjhāna īsanā nīvaraṇehi suññā pe
translated: The search for the first jhana is void of the hindrances.

analyzed: arahatta magga īsanā sabba kilesehi suññā
translated: The search for the path of arahantship is void of all the defilements.

analyzed: idam esanā suñña
translated: This is the voidness of search.

analyzed: katamam
translated: What is voidness of grasping?

analyzed: nekkhamma pariggahaḥ kāmacchandena suññaḥ
translated: The grasping of renunciation is void of sensual desire.

analyzed: a byāpāda pariggahaḥ byāpādena suññaḥ
translated: The grasping of non-ill-will is void of ill-will.

analyzed: āloka saññā pariggaho thinam iddhena suññaḥ  avikkhepa pariggahaḥ uddhaccena suññaḥ
translated: The grasping of the perception of light is void of stiffness and torpor.🔽The grasping of non-distraction is void of agitation.

analyzed: dhamma vavatthāna pariggahaḥ vicikicchāya suññaḥ
translated: The grasping of the determination of ideas is void of uncertainty.

analyzed: ñāṇa pariggahaḥ avijjāya suññaḥ
translated: The grasping of knowledge is void of ignorance.

analyzed: pāmojja pariggahaḥ aratiyā suññaḥ
translated: The acquisition of gladness is void of disliking.

analyzed: paṭhamajjhāna pariggahaḥ nīvaraṇehi suññaḥ pe
translated: The acquisition of the first jhāna is void of the hindrances. …

analyzed: arahatta magga pariggaho sabba kilesehi suññaḥ
translated: The acquisition of the path of arahantship is void of all defilements.

analyzed: idam pariggahasuñña
translated: This is voidness of acquisition.

analyzed: katamam
translated: What is voidness of obtainment?

analyzed: nekkhamma paṭilābho kāmacchandena suñño
translated: The obtainment of renunciation is void of sensuality.

analyzed: a byāpāda paṭilābhaḥ byāpādena suññaḥ
translated: The obtainment of non-ill-will is void of ill-will.

analyzed: āloka saññā paṭilābho thinam iddhena suññaḥ  avikkhepa paṭilābhaḥ uddhaccena suññaḥ
translated: The obtainment of the perception of light is void of stiffness and torpor.🔽The obtainment of non-distraction is void of agitation.

analyzed: dhamma vavatthāna paṭilābhaḥ vicikicchāya suññaḥ  ñāṇa paṭilābhaḥ avijjāya suñño
translated: The obtainment of the establishment of mindfulness is void of doubt.🔽The obtainment of knowledge is void of ignorance.

analyzed: pāmojja paṭilābhaḥ aratiyā suñño
translated: The obtainment of gladness is void of disliking.

analyzed: paṭhamajjhāna paṭilābhaḥ nīvaraṇehi suññaḥ pe
translated: The obtainment of the first jhāna is void of the hindrances. …

analyzed: arahatta magga paṭilābho sabba kilesehi suññaḥ
translated: The obtainment of the path of arahantship is void of all defilements.

analyzed: idam
translated: This is voidness of obtainment.

analyzed: katamam
translated: What is voidness of penetration?

analyzed: nekkhamma ppaṭivedhaḥ kāmacchandena suññaḥ
translated: The penetration of renunciation is void of sensuality.

analyzed: a byāpāda paṭivedhaḥ byāpādena suññaḥ
translated: The penetration of non-ill-will is void of ill-will.

analyzed: āloka saññā appaṭivedho thinam iddhena suñño
translated: The penetration of the perception of light is void of stiffness and torpor.🔽…

analyzed: avikkhepa paṭivedhaḥ uddhaccena suññaḥ
translated: Penetration of non-distraction is void of agitation.

analyzed: dhamma vavatthāna paṭivedhaḥ vicikicchāya suññaḥ  ñāṇa paṭivedhaḥ avijjāya suññaḥ
translated: Penetration of defining of ideas is void of doubt.🔽Penetration of knowledge is void of ignorance.

analyzed: pāmojja paṭivedhaḥ aratiyā suññaḥ
translated: Penetration of gladness is void of disliking.

analyzed: paṭhamajjhāna paṭivedhaḥ nīvaraṇehi suññaḥ pe
translated: Penetration of the first jhana is void of the hindrances. …

analyzed: arahatta magga ppaṭivedho sabba kilesehi suññaḥ
translated: Penetration of the path of arahatship is void of all defilements.

analyzed: idam
translated: This is voidness of penetration.

original: Katamaṁ ekattasuññaṁ, nānattasuññaṁ?🔽Kāmacchando nānattaṁ, nekkhammaṁ ekattaṁ.
analyzed: katamaṃ ekatta suñña nānatta suñña  kāmacchandaḥ nānatta nekkhammam ekatta
translated: What is voidness of unity and voidness of diversity?🔽Sensual desire is diversity, renunciation is unity.

analyzed: nekkhammekattam cetayataḥ kāmacchandena
translated: When he resolves on renunciation as unity, he is void of sensual desire.

analyzed: byāpādaḥ nānatta a byāpādaḥ ekatta
translated: Ill will is diversity, non-ill will is unity.

analyzed: a byāpāda ekattam cetayataḥ byāpādena
translated: When he resolves on non-ill will as unity, he is void of ill will.

original: Thinamiddhaṁ nānattaṁ, ālokasaññā ekattaṁ.🔽Ālokasaññekattaṁ cetayato thinamiddhena suññaṁ.🔽Uddhaccaṁ nānattaṁ, avikkhepo ekattaṁ.
analyzed: thinam iddham nānatte āloka saññā ekatta  āloka saññekattam cetayataḥ thinam iddhena  uddhaccam nānatta avikkhepaḥ ekatta
translated: Stiffness and torpor are diversity, perception of light is unity.🔽When he resolves on perception of light as unity, he is void of stiffness and torpor.🔽Agitation is diversity, non-distraction is unity.

analyzed: a vikkhepa ikattam cetayataḥ uddhaccena
translated: When he resolves on non-distraction as unity, he is void of agitation.

analyzed: vicikicchā nānatta dhamma vavatthānaṃ ekatta
translated: Doubt is diversity, defining of ideas is unity.

original: Dhammavavatthānekattaṁ cetayato vicikicchāya suññaṁ.🔽Avijjā nānattaṁ, ñāṇaṁ ekattaṁ.
analyzed: dhamma vavatthāna ekattam cetayataḥ vicikicchāya  avijjā nānatta ñāṇam ekatta
translated: When he adverts to the singleness of the defining of ideas, it is void of doubt.🔽Ignorance is the diversity, and knowledge is the singleness.

original: Ñāṇekattaṁ cetayato avijjāya suññaṁ.🔽Arati nānattaṁ, pāmojjaṁ ekattaṁ.
analyzed: ñāṇekattam cetayataḥ avijjāya  arati nānatta pāmojjam ekatta
translated: When he adverts to the singleness of knowledge, it is void of ignorance.🔽Disenchantment is the diversity, and gladness is the singleness.

analyzed: pāmojjekattam cetayataḥ aratiyā suñña
translated: When he adverts to the singleness of gladness, it is void of disenchantment.

analyzed: nīvaraṇāḥ nānatta paṭhamajjhānam ekatta
translated: The hindrances are the diversity, and the first jhāna is the singleness.

original: Paṭhamajjhānekattaṁ cetayato nīvaraṇehi suññaṁ …pe…🔽sabbakilesā nānattaṁ, arahattamaggo ekattaṁ.
analyzed: paṭhama jhāna ekattam cetayataḥ nīvaraṇehi suññam pe  sabba kilesā nānatta arahatta maggo ekatta
translated: When he adverts to the singleness of the first jhāna, it is void of the hindrances. …🔽All the defilements are the diversity, and the path of arahatship is the singleness.

analyzed: arahatta magga ekattam cetayato sabba kilesehi
translated: When he adverts to the singleness of the path of arahatship, it is void of all the defilements.

analyzed: idam ekatta suññam nānatta suñña
translated: This is the voidness of singleness and diversity.

analyzed: katamam
translated: What is the voidness of acquiescence?

analyzed: nekkhamma khanti kāmacchandena suññā
translated: Acquiescence in renunciation is void of lust.

original: Abyāpādakhanti byāpādena suññā.🔽Ālokasaññākhanti thinamiddhena suññā.🔽Avikkhepakhanti uddhaccena suññā.
analyzed: a byāpāda khanti byāpādena suññā  āloka saññā khanti thinam iddhena suññā  avikkhepa khanti uddhaccena suññā
translated: Acquiescence in non-ill-will is void of ill-will.🔽Acquiescence in perception of light is void of stiffness-and-torpor.🔽Acquiescence in non-distraction is void of agitation.

analyzed: dhamma vavatthāna khanti vicikicchāya suññā  ñāṇa khanti avijjāya suññā
translated: Acquiescence in defining of ideas is void of uncertainty.🔽Acquiescence in knowledge is void of ignorance.

analyzed: pāmojjakhanti aratiyā suññā
translated: Acquiescence in gladness is void of disenchantment.

analyzed: paṭhamajjhāna khanti nīvaraṇehi suññā pe
translated: The willingness for the first absorption is void of the hindrances. …

analyzed: arahatta magga khanti sabba kilesehi suññā
translated: The willingness for the path of arahantship is void of all the defilements.

analyzed: idam khantisuñña
translated: This is voidness of willingness.

analyzed: katamam
translated: What is voidness of determination?

original: Nekkhammādhiṭṭhānaṁ kāmacchandena suññaṁ.🔽Abyāpādādhiṭṭhānaṁ byāpādena suññaṁ.🔽Ālokasaññādhiṭṭhānaṁ thinamiddhena suññaṁ.
analyzed: nekkhamma adhiṭṭhānam kāmacchandena  a byāpāda adhiṭṭhānam byāpādena  āloka saññā adhiṭṭhānam thinam iddhena
translated: The determination for renunciation is void of sensuality.🔽The determination for non-ill will is void of ill will.🔽The determination for the perception of light is void of stiffness and torpor.

analyzed: avikkhepa adhiṭṭhānam uddhaccena suñña  dhamma vavatthāna adhiṭṭhānam vicikicchāya
translated: The determination for non-distraction is void of agitation.🔽The determination for defining of ideas is void of uncertainty.

analyzed: ñāṇa adhiṭṭhānam avijjāya
translated: The determination for knowledge is void of ignorance.

analyzed: pāmojja adhiṭṭhānam aratiyā
translated: The determination for gladness is void of grief.

analyzed: paṭhamajjhāna adhiṭṭhānam nīvaraṇehi suññam pe
translated: The determination for the first absorption is void of the hindrances. …

analyzed: arahatta magga adhiṭṭhānam sabba kilesehi
translated: The determination for the path of arahantship is void of all the defilements.

analyzed: idam
translated: This is voidness of determination.

analyzed: katamam
translated: What is voidness of grasping?

analyzed: nekkhamma pariyogāhaṇam kāmacchandena  a byāpāda pariyogāhaṇam byāpādena
translated: The grasping of renunciation is void of sensuality.🔽The grasping of non-ill will is void of ill will.🔽The grasping of the perception of light is void of stiffness and torpor.

analyzed: āloka saññā pariyogāhaṇam thinam iddhena
translated: The inclusion of perception of light is empty of stiffness and torpor.

original: Avikkhepapariyogāhaṇaṁ uddhaccena suññaṁ.🔽Dhammavavatthānapariyogāhaṇaṁ vicikicchāya suññaṁ.🔽Ñāṇapariyogāhaṇaṁ avijjāya suññaṁ.

analyzed: pāmojja pariyogāhaṇam aratiyā
translated: The inclusion of the factor of knowledge is void of ignorance.🔽The inclusion of the factor of gladness is void of disquiet.

analyzed: paṭhamajjhāna pariyogāhaṇam nīvaraṇehi suññam pe

analyzed: arahatta magga pariyogāhaṇam sabba kilesehi
translated: The inclusion of the path of arahatship is void of all defilements.

analyzed: idam
translated: This is voidness of inclusion.

analyzed: katamam sampajānassa pavatta pariyādānam sabba suññatānam paramattha suññatā
translated: What is the voidness of the exhaustion of the occurrence of one who is fully aware?🔽Herein, one who is fully aware exhausts the occurrence of lust by non-greed,

original: Idha sampajāno nekkhammena kāmacchandassa pavattaṁ pariyādiyati, abyāpādena byāpādassa🔽pavattaṁ pariyādiyati, ālokasaññāya thinamiddhassa pavattaṁ pariyādiyati, avikkhepena
analyzed: idha sampajānaḥ nekkhammena kāmacchandassa pavattam pariyādiyati a byāpādena byāpādassa  pavattam pariyādiyati āloka saññāya thinamiddhassa pavattam pariyādiyati avikkhepena
translated: he exhausts the occurrence of ill will by non-ill will,🔽he exhausts the occurrence of stiffness and torpor by perception of light,🔽he exhausts the occurrence of agitation by non-distraction,

original: uddhaccassa pavattaṁ pariyādiyati, dhammavavatthānena vicikicchāya pavattaṁ pariyādiyati,
analyzed: uddhaccassa pavattam pariyādiyati dhamma vavatthānena vicikicchāya pavattam pariyādiyati
translated: he exhausts the occurrence of uncertainty by defining of ideas,

original: ñāṇena avijjāya pavattaṁ pariyādiyati, pāmojjena aratiyā pavattaṁ pariyādiyati, paṭhamena
analyzed: ñāṇena avijjāya pavattam pariyādiyati pāmojjena aratiyā pavattam pariyādiyati paṭhamena
translated: with knowledge he conquers the occurrence of ignorance, with joy he conquers the occurrence of disliking, with the first

analyzed: jhānena nīvaraṇānam pavattam pariyādiyati pe
translated: with knowledge he conquers the occurrence of ignorance, with gladness he conquers the occurrence of disliking, with the first jhāna he conquers the occurrence of the hindrances, …

analyzed: arahatta maggena sabba kilesānam pavattam pariyādiyati
translated: with the path of arahantship he conquers the occurrence of all defilements.

original: Atha vā pana sampajānassa anupādisesāya nibbānadhātuyā parinibbāyantassa idaṁ ceva cakkhupavattaṁ pariyādiyati, aññañca cakkhupavattaṁ na uppajjati.
analyzed: atha vā pana sampajānassa anupādisesāya nibbānadhātuyā parinibbāyantassa idam ca iva cakkhu upavattam pariyādiyati aññam ca cakkhu upavattam na uppajjati
translated: Or else, when one who is fully aware attains Nibbāna in the element of Nibbāna that is without residue of clinging, then he conquers the occurrence of eye-consciousness and no other occurrence of eye-consciousness appears.

analyzed: idam ca iva sota pavattam pe  ghānapavattam  jivhā pavattam
translated: And he conquers the occurrence of ear-consciousness …🔽the occurrence of nose-consciousness …🔽the occurrence of tongue-consciousness …

analyzed: kāya pavattam
translated: the occurrence of body-consciousness …

original: manopavattaṁ pariyādiyati, aññañca manopavattaṁ na uppajjati.
analyzed: manopavattam pariyādiyati aññañca manopavattam na uppajjati
translated: the occurrence of mind-consciousness and no other occurrence of mind-consciousness appears.

analyzed: idam sampajānassa pavatta pariyādānam sabba suñña tānam paramattha suññanti
translated: This is the conquest of the occurrence of what is fully aware. It is the ultimate voidness of all voids.

analyzed: suñña kathā niṭṭhitā  yuga naddha vaggaḥ dutiyaḥ
translated: The Discussion of Voidness is ended.

analyzed: lokuttara bala suññā ti

original: Esa nikāyadharehi ṭhapito, asamo dutiyo pavaro varavaggoti.
analyzed: esa nikāya dharehi ṭhapitaḥ asamaḥ dutiyaḥ pavaraḥ vara vaggo ti
